meanings.definition: A person, typically a man, who controls prostitutes and arranges clients for them, taking a percentage of their earnings in return.
meanings.sent1: The pimps in the city were arrested by the police.
meanings.sent2: She refused to work for the pimps in the dangerous area.
meanings.sent3: The movie portrayed the pimps as villains who exploited vulnerable women.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, some see large corporations as the pimps of the economy.
meanings.sent5: The image of the pimps in the dark alley was unsettling.

meanings.sent1: He decided to pimps for a living, much to his family's dismay.
meanings.sent2: She pimps for a notorious criminal organization.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would never pimps even for a million dollars.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to pimps effectively made her stand out in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The undercover agent had to pimps to gather information discreetly.

meanings.definition: A person who caters to or exploits the weaknesses of others.
meanings.sent1: The scammer was a master at manipulating people's emotions, a true pimps.
meanings.sent2: She saw through the facade of the supposed pimps offering quick fixes.
meanings.sent3: The cunning pimps convinced many to buy unnecessary products.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the antagonist was portrayed as a pimps preying on the protagonist's vulnerabilities.
meanings.sent5: The politician was seen as a pimps by his opponents for taking advantage of public trust.
